CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles Grimstad, attorney, Ben Avon and Miss Carol Strain, clerk, Crafton, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 14, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion what political party has done the most for the Negroes?" Mr. Charles Grimstad's answer reads: "In the early stages of the New Deal, the Democrats did more for the Negroes than the Republicans.  However, since 1945, it is pretty much an even balance.  It seems to depend on which party is in the White House."  Miss Carol Strain's answer reads: "I'm a Republican and it seems to me that the Republican party has done more.  They just want integration."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Atty. Charles Grimstad wearing dark suit jacket, patterned necktie, and eyeglasses, standing in front of wall with sign; Portrait of Carol Strain wearing dark short jacket with wide collar, standing in front of wall with sign, woman wearing sunglasses in background
